skills.name: Remembering
examples: List the parts of a plant cell.
State the three types of mixtures.
Name the common lab apparatus used to measure liquids.

skills.name: Understanding
examples: Explain why rusting is considered a chemical change.
Describe the function of the human excretory system.
Differentiate between homogeneous and heterogeneous mixtures.

skills.name: Applying
examples: Apply the knowledge of separation to suggest how to purify muddy water.
Demonstrate safe handling of a Bunsen burner in a lab setting.

skills.name: Analyzing
examples: Analyze how changes in pressure affect fluid systems.
Identify similarities between plant and animal cells based on structure.

skills.name: Evaluating
skills.description: Justifying a decision or course of action
examples: Evaluate the effectiveness of different water purification methods.
Justify the use of solar energy over charcoal for cooking.
Assess the impact of poor waste disposal on the environment.

skills.name: Creating
examples: Describe an experiment to test solubility of different substances.
